The laboratory is equipped with modern instruments.
One dollar is roughly equivalent to seven yuan.
There is a spelling error in your report.

vocabulary.definition: 必不可少的，极其重要的
vocabulary.example_sentence: Water is essential for all living things.
They established a new company last year.
He inherited a large estate from his grandfather.
Can you estimate how long it will take to finish?
Teachers need to evaluate students' progress regularly.
After many attempts, he eventually succeeded.
The police found evidence at the crime scene.
Don't exaggerate the difficulties you faced.
Everyone must attend the meeting without exception.
Excessive drinking can damage your health.
They exchanged phone numbers after the meeting.
She is a senior executive in the company.
You need to exert more effort to pass the exam.
The long journey exhausted the children.
The museum will exhibit ancient artifacts next month.
The company plans to expand its business overseas.
The expansion of the company created many new jobs.
The product did not meet our expectations.
We need to reduce our monthly expenses.

vocabulary.definition: 探索；探讨，研究；（用手或身体某部）摸索；勘察
vocabulary.example_sentence: They explored the possibility of working together.
The report exposed the truth about the incident.
Children need exposure to different cultures.
They built an extension to their house.
I was surprised by the extent of his knowledge.
They live in extreme poverty.

vocabulary.definition: 设施，设备；（供特定用途的）场所
vocabulary.example_sentence: The sports facility is open to the public.
Cost is an important factor in our decision.
The faculty meeting will be held next Monday.

vocabulary.definition: 失败；失败者；未做，未履行（应做之事）
vocabulary.example_sentence: Failure is the mother of success.
He has been a faithful friend for many years.
She wore a fancy dress to the party.

vocabulary.definition: 交通费；（事情）进行得（好或坏）
vocabulary.example_sentence: The bus fare has increased recently.

vocabulary.definition: 时髦，风尚；方式；制作，塑造
vocabulary.example_sentence: She always dresses in the latest fashion.
The accident caused fatal injuries.

vocabulary.definition: 赞同的，称赞的；有利的，有助于...的
vocabulary.example_sentence: The weather conditions are favorable for sailing.

vocabulary.definition: 赞许的，称赞的，肯定的；有利的，顺利的，良...
vocabulary.example_sentence: The reviews for the movie were mostly favourable.
The plan seems feasible with our current resources.

vocabulary.definition: 特征，特点，特色；以......为主要组成；起重...
vocabulary.example_sentence: The new model features improved safety.

vocabulary.definition: 想出；认为，认定；数字；人影，人物；身形...
vocabulary.example_sentence: I can't figure out how to solve this problem.
You need to file the application before the deadline.
The company is facing financial difficulties.
The land here is very flat.
We need a flexible approach to solve this problem.

vocabulary.definition: 给予某物关注；中心，重点；焦点
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please focus on your work.
Smoking is forbidden in this building.

vocabulary.definition: 格式；总体安排；版式；设计；设计一个版式...
vocabulary.example_sentence: The document needs to be in PDF format.
The former president visited our school.
They set forth on their journey at dawn.
Education is the foundation of a successful career.
She put the photo in a beautiful frame.

vocabulary.definition: 功能，作用，用途，机能；工作，运转；起...
vocabulary.example_sentence: The function of the heart is to pump blood.

vocabulary.definition: 拨款，提供资金；资金，基金
vocabulary.example_sentence: The government will fund the research project.
There is a large gap between rich and poor.

vocabulary.definition: 引起，造成，创造；产生（热、电等能量）
vocabulary.example_sentence: The wind turbines generate electricity.
She made a generous donation to the charity.
She has a genuine interest in helping others.

vocabulary.definition: 手势，姿势；做手势，用动作示意
vocabulary.example_sentence: He made a gesture of apology.
The university granted her a scholarship.
She resolved to study harder for the next exam.
We stayed at a beautiful beach resort.

vocabulary.definition: 回应；做出反应；回答，回复
vocabulary.example_sentence: He didn't respond to my email.

vocabulary.definition: 反应；回应；回答，答复；响应
vocabulary.example_sentence: We received a positive response to our proposal.
It's your responsibility to complete the task.
Who is responsible for this mess?
They restored the old building to its original condition.
It's important to retain important documents.
My father will retire next year.

vocabulary.definition: 撤退，退却；休养所，收容所
vocabulary.example_sentence: The army was forced to retreat.
The investigation revealed new evidence.

vocabulary.definition: 税收，（公司或组织的）收益；收入，财政收入
vocabulary.example_sentence: The company's revenue increased by 20% this year.

vocabulary.definition: 使……逆转；撤销，废除；反面的

Hard work brings its own reward.

vocabulary.definition: 攀升，攀枝树；等级，级别，等级体系；天平，磅秤
vocabulary.example_sentence: The map was drawn to scale.
I need to scan these documents.
The police arrived at the crime scene.

vocabulary.definition: 预订，安排；时间表，计划表；日程安排
vocabulary.example_sentence: The meeting is scheduled for tomorrow.

vocabulary.definition: (用于检验、分析的) 试样，样品
vocabulary.example_sentence: They took a blood sample for testing.

vocabulary.definition: 方案，计划；阴谋，诡计；图谋，密谋
vocabulary.example_sentence: They developed a scheme to save money.
The scope of the project is quite large.
The movie appeared on the big screen.

vocabulary.definition: 中学的；从属的，辅助的；第二的
vocabulary.example_sentence: This is a secondary issue compared to the main problem.
The technology sector is growing rapidly.
Make sure the door is secure before leaving.
Airport security has been increased.
Please select your preferred option.

vocabulary.definition: (大学或高中) 毕业生；年长的人；资格者…
vocabulary.example_sentence: She is a senior at the university.

vocabulary.definition: 明智的，理智的；实用耐穿的
vocabulary.example_sentence: That's a sensible decision.
She has sensitive skin.
They published a series of articles on the topic.
The police used shields for protection.
He works the night shift at the factory.

The traffic signal turned red.

vocabulary.definition: 有重大意义的，重要的；数量相当大的；显著的
vocabulary.example_sentence: There has been a significant increase in sales.
They visited the historical site.
She made a quick sketch of the landscape.
The stone skimmed across the water.
She has a slender figure.
He made a slip in his calculations.

vocabulary.definition: 唯一的；独有的；脚底，鞋底，袜底
vocabulary.example_sentence: She is the sole owner of the company.

vocabulary.definition: 减少；收缩；缩小；心理医生

Can you solve this math problem?

vocabulary.definition: 特定的；具体的；特殊的；针对……的
vocabulary.example_sentence: Please give me specific instructions.

The company spokesman made an announcement.

vocabulary.definition: 看见，注意到，发现；地点；排名位置；点
vocabulary.example_sentence: I spotted a mistake in the report.
The river is the source of drinking water.

vocabulary.definition: 推动；激励，鞭策；刺激，鞭策，鼓励

vocabulary.definition: 刺激（身体部位等）；激发，促进

vocabulary.definition: （生物体）品种，种类；拉紧，使……变紧张

vocabulary.definition: 学科，科目；主题；实验对象；使臣服，使顺
